head.title: Glossy Visits to Flea Markets and Cooking Schools

hedline.hl1: Glossy Visits to Flea Markets and Cooking Schools

abstract.p: Williams-Sonoma is publishing new food magazine, Taste; photo (S)

block.p: THERE'S a shiny new face in the parade of glossy food magazines: Taste, a well-mannered publication just introduced by Williams-Sonoma. It is pretty enough, and it covers a broad territory: cooking, entertaining, wine, travel and chefs. But it lacks the depth or distinctive voice of Saveur or Cook's Illustrated.

Its editor, Andy Harris, ran the Australian magazine Vogue Entertaining. In Taste, he writes articles and develops recipes -- this month on ''posh squash'' and ''distinctive desserts,'' among others. The first issue has articles on Parisian flea markets and cooking schools and on Christmas with Jean-Georges Vongerichten. The next issue -- there will be five a year -- will focus on American cooking.

THERE'S a shiny new face in the parade of glossy food magazines: Taste, a well-mannered publication just introduced by Williams-Sonoma. It is pretty enough, and it covers a broad territory: cooking, entertaining, wine, travel and chefs. But it lacks the depth or distinctive voice of Saveur or Cook's Illustrated.

Its editor, Andy Harris, ran the Australian magazine Vogue Entertaining. In Taste, he writes articles and develops recipes -- this month on ''posh squash'' and ''distinctive desserts,'' among others. The first issue has articles on Parisian flea markets and cooking schools and on Christmas with Jean-Georges Vongerichten. The next issue -- there will be five a year -- will focus on American cooking.

Deborah Madison and Joyce Goldstein are regular contributors, and so is Chuck Williams, 84, the founder of Williams-Sonoma, who writes a column and advises Mr. Harris. The store's products are occasionally promoted. For example, a food news feature includes two Williams-Sonoma items and one from Pottery Barn, a unit of Williams-Sonoma.
For the first issue, 250,000 copies were printed. It costs $5 at Williams-Sonoma, Barnes & Noble and Borders Books; by subscription, $20 a year: (800) 541-2233.
